points.text: Take a campus tour or check out our virtual tour.
See Hunter the Ridgeback’s welcome for our incoming class.
Accept your offer of admission by Thursday, June 1.
Apply to residence by Thursday, June 1.

Submit your final post-secondary transcripts and course syllabi by Thursday, June 1 to ensure your transfer credit evaluation is complete before the beginning of the fall semester. For details on what is required, visit your applicant portal.
Attend Financing Your Education information night on Wednesday, June 14 or Tuesday, June 20.
Pay your $500 non-refundable tuition deposit by Thursday, June 15.
Register for courses. You will receive an email from the Registrar’s office with your registration window and instructions.
If you are upgrading over the summer, submit an upgrading form by Friday, June 30.

Register for your laptop pick-up if you are in one of the following:
  • All programs in the Faculty of Energy Systems and Nuclear Science
  • All programs in the Faculty of Engineering and Applied Science
  • Game Development and Entrepreneurship program
Attend iBegin on your faculty-specific date
Order your textbooks through the Campus Bookstore.
Pick up your student ID card.

Submit any outstanding documentation (including upgrading marks) by Friday, August 11.
Please note: Summer upgrading marks (completed after June 30) will not be accepted for competitive programs such as Nursing and Medical Laboratory Science.
Submit final marks for upgrading courses by Friday, August 11.
Pay your first instalment of fees by Friday, August 18. You’ll find a complete breakdown of your fees in your MyCampus account.
Attend Smart Start to build a strong academic foundation for university.
Attend September Orientation on Tuesday, September 5 and Wednesday, September 6.
